DOC.brief_summary: A new intravenous medication is being tested for the prevention of the nausea and vomiting that occurs after surgery. This new medication is being compared to another intravenous medication that is already available to patients for this indication.
DOC.brief_title: A Study to Examine the Safety and Tolerability of MK0517 for the Prevention of Post-Operative Nausea and Vomiting (0517-015)
DOC.criteria: Open abdominal surgery requiring 24 hour hospital stay General anesthesia Postoperative opioids ASA status of IIII Patient exhibits evidence of any clinically significant respiratory, metabolic, hepatic, renal dysfunction, or cardiovascular condition or congestive heart failure (CHF) Morbid obesity Patient is mentally incapacitated or has a significant emotional or psychiatric disorder
